sentences.text: March 22, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To My Fellow Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors and executive leadership team cordially invite you to attend the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held at the Houston Marriott Westchase, 2900 Briarpark Drive, Houston, Texas 77042, on Wednesday, May 3 at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will find information regarding the matters to be voted on at the meeting in the attached proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 is a diversified energy manufacturing and logistics company with a portfolio of midstream, chemicals, refining, and marketing and specialties businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our diverse portfolio, resilient cash flow and disciplined capital allocation position us to capitalize on opportunities across the value chain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate strategy remains unchanged and clear we aim to deliver profitable growth, enhance returns on capital, and grow shareholder distributions, underpinned by strong operating excellence and a high-performing organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These founding principles remain the pillars of all that we do.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I look forward to sharing more about your company when we gather for our annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Honor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commitment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are the values that guide how the 14,800 employees of Phillips 66 conduct business every day as they work to fulfill our mission to provide energy an mprove lives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also guided by our four pillars of sustainability: operational excellence, environmental commitment, social responsibility and economic performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our commitment to shareholder engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value the perspectives our shareholders provide by participating at our annual meeting and engaging in conversations with us throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we invited shareholders representing approximately half of our shares outstanding to discuss governance, compensation and other topics of interest to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response, shareholders provided valuable feedback that was shared with the full Board, which considered that feedback in its decision making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these discussions, the Board adopted a proxy access bylaw earlier this year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The valuable input we receive from shareholders is very important to the Board and we look forward to continuing our dialogue in the coming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Growing shareholder distributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We understand the importance of growing shareholder distributions in the form of share repurchases and dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we increased the dividend by 13 percent and returned $2.3 billion of capital to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the annual meeting in person, and no matter how many shares you own, please vote by telephone or the Internet, or mark yo vote on the enclosed proxy card and sign, date, and return it by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information on voting your shares, please see the instructions in the proxy statement on page 57.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to greeting you on May 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Greg C. Garland Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IMPROVING THE LIVES OF CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 supports educational programs that contribute to the vibrancy and resilience of communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognizing that an educated workforce moves the world forward, we invest in teaching the skills that are critical to developing energy solutions for the 21st century.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key among these skills is competence in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) disciplines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One way we demonstrate that support is our participation with the MIND Research Institute, a nonprofit organization that develops visually based software to enhance learning and brings visual math instruction and game-based learning to local schools.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MIND's signature ST Math program, game-based instructional software for K-12, is designed to boost math comprehension and proficiency through visual learning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With this program, we aim to instill a love of math in students and develop tomorrow's problem solvers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2014, Phillips 66 has contributed $2.5 million to the Institute and sponsored the ST Math program in 50 schools, many of them in the communities in which we operate: Freeport, Brazoria, and Houston, Texas; Ponca City, Oklahoma; Billings, Montana; Ferndale, Washington; and Wilmington, California.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We often accompany this gift with the technology needed to ensure a successful implementation, such as 3-D printers and Chromebook computers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the children sitting in classrooms today are tomorrow's energy industry leaders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That's why Phillips 66 is investing in STEM education.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this partnership will help us fuel students' interest in science, technology, engineering and math, while preparing them for the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 is a diversified energy manufacturing and logistics company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With a unique portfolio of assets in the Midstream, Chemicals, Refining, and Marketing and Specialties businesses, the Company processes, transports, stores and markets fuels and products globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our industry is vitally important to the global economy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fossil fuels, particularly oil and natural gas, are the world's primary energy source and are expected to remain so for decades to come.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sources are abundant and reliable, affordable and efficient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66's mission is to provide energy and improve lives through operating excellence, delivering energy safely, efficiently and sustainably.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We improve lives by responsibly providing energy products that are essential for a high standard of living and health throughout the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our financial performance in 2016 demonstrated the resiliency of our diversified portfolio in a volatile market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We create value by focusing on operating excellence, enhancing returns in Refining and executing our Midstream and Chemicals growth programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our balance sheet is strong, and we maintain a disciplined approach to capital allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The graph below shows our total shareholder return (TSR) since May 2012 compared to the S&P 100 Index and our performance peer group, which is detailed in Peer Group ComparisonsPerformance Peer Group in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business requires that we not only bring together a knowledgeable and qualified leadership team, but one with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.

sentences.text: The composition of our Board and the experiences and backgrounds of our executives reflect the Company's ongoing organizational commitment to diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee, which we may also refer to as the Nominating Committee, seeks Board members who possess the highest personal and professional ethics, integrity and values, and are ommitted to representing the long-term interests of the Company's shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee regularly reviews the composition of the Board and the evolving needs of the Company's businesses to ensure the Board reflects a range of talents, ages, skills, experiences, diversity, and expertise, particularly in the areas of accounting and finance, management, omestic and international markets, leadership, environment, and energy-related industries, sufficient to provide sound and prudent guidance with respect to the Company's strategic and perational objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charts below highlight the diversity and independence of our ten-member Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Shareholder Engagement Effort
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the past year, we invited shareholders representing approximately half of our shares outstanding to discuss topics of interest to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response, shareholders provided valuable feedback that was shared with the full Board, which considered that feedback in its decision making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Topics discussed included our strategy and performance; corporate governance matters; our executive compensation programs; and environmental and social concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a direct result of these discussions, we recently adopted a proxy access bylaw giving shareholders holding at least 3 percent of our shares for at least 3 years the right to include in the proxy statement director nominees for up to 20 percent of the Board (but not less than two nominees).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we encouraged shareholders at the last two annual meetings to approve a management proposal to eliminate our classified board structure and permit all directors to be elected annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unfortunately, the proposal did not receive the required vote to pass in either year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consulted with our proxy solicitor, who advised us, based on its analysis of our shareholder base, that the proposal would likely not be successful this year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also discussed this topic with our largest investors and they conveyed understanding for this conclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we are not resubmitting the proposal at the Annual Meeting, but will continue to discuss this matter and others with our investors to ensure they have a meaningful voice in our boardroom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Human Resources and Compensation Committee, which we refer to as the Compensation Committee, values these discussions and encourages shareholders to provide comments about our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the overwhelmingly positive result of our 2016 say-on-pay vote (95% support), as well as the feedback received during ongoing shareholder engagement meetings, we believe our shareholders approve of our executive compensation program and recognize its link to our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, we continue to evaluate our compensation program in light of evolving best practices to ensure alignment with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of Compensation Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with our corporate strategy, executive compensation philosophy and shareholder feedback, the following best practices are reflected in our executive compensation programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE DO ...
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WE DO NOT ...
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target the majority of Named Executive Officer (NEO) compensation to be performance based    Provide excise tax gross-ups to our NEOs under our CICSP  Link NEO compensation to shareholder value creation by having a significant portion of compensation at risk    Reprice stock options without shareholder approval  Apply multiple performance metrics aligned with our corporate strategy to measure our performance    Price stock options below grant date fair market value  Cap maximum payouts (number of shares) under our equity programs    Allow share recycling for stock options  Employ a "double trigger" for severance benefits and equity awards under our Key Employee Change in Control Severance Plan (CICSP)    Have evergreen provisions in our active equity plans  Include absolute and relative metrics in our Long-Term Incentive (LTI) programs    Allow hedging or pledging of Phillips 66 stock, or trading Phillips 66 stock outside of approved windows  Maintain stock ownership guidelines for executivesChief Executive Officer (CEO) 6x base salary; other NEOs 3-5x base salary    Pay dividends during the performance period on Performance Share Program (PSP) targets  Balance, monitor and manage compensation risk through regular assessments and robust clawback provisions    Allow transfer of equity awards (except in the case of death)  Have extended vesting periods on stock awards, with a minimum one-year vesting period required for stock and stock option awards    Provide separate supplemental executive retirement benefits for individual NEOs  Intend to qualify compensation payments for deductibility under Internal Revenue Code (IRC) Section 162(m)    Maintain individual change-in-control agreements  Maintain a fully independent Compensation Committee    Have an employment agreement with the CEO  Retain an independent compensation consultant    Have excessive perquisites  Hold a Say-on-Pay vote annually
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE OF THE COMPANY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee and the Board of Directors, which we may also refer to as the Board, annually review the Company's governance structure to take into account changes in Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) rules, as well as current best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines, posted on the "Investors" section of the Company's website under the "Governance" caption and available in print upon request (see Available Information on page 61), address the following matters, among others:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: committees of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director access to officers, employees and independent advisors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance evaluations of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director orientation and continuing education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman and CEO Roles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board of Directors has the authority to separate the positions of Chairman and CEO if it deems appropriate, the Board believes it is in the best interest of the Company's shareholders to combine them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Doing so enables one person to guide the Board in setting priorities for the Company and in addressing the risks and challenges the Company faces.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that, while its non-employee Directors bring a diversity of skills and perspectives to the Board, the Company's CEO, by virtue of his day-to-day involvement in managing the Company, currently is best suited to serve as Chairman and perform this unified role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that no single organizational model is the most effective in all circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a consequence, the Board periodically considers whether the offices of Chairman and CEO should continue to be combined and who should serve in such capacities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also periodically reexamines its corporate governance policies and leadership structure to ensure that they continue to meet the Company's needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this review, the Board rotated committee chairs and committee membership in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decision to rotate committee positions was not taken lightly given the benefits that can come from continuity and the expertise of members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee, however, believed that rotating committee positions would be beneficial, providing fresh perspectives and enhancing Directors' familiarity with different aspects of the Company's business while maintaining subject matter expertise on all committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines also contain director independence standards, which are consistent with the standards set forth in the NYSE listing standards, to assist the Board of Directors in determining the independence of the Company's Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each Director, except Mr. Garland, meets the standards regarding independence set forth in the Corporate Governance Guidelines and is free of any material relationship with the Company (either directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with the Company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Garland is not considered independent because he is an executive officer of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making independence determinations, the Board of Directors specifically considered the fact that many of our Directors are directors, current or retired officers or shareholders of companies with which we conduct business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, some of our Directors serve as employees of, or consultants to, companies that do business with Phillips 66 and its affiliates (as further described in Related Party Transactions on page 13).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, some of our Directors may purchase retail products (such as gasoline, fuel additives or lubricants) from the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, it was determined that the nature of the business conducted and the interest of the Director by virtue of such position were immaterial both to the Company and to such Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's values embrace shareholder engagement as an important tenet of good governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value the views of our shareholders and believe that positive dialogue builds informed relationships that promote transparency and accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Lead Director or other members of the Board are available to participate in meetings with shareholders as appropriate, management has the principal responsibility for shareholder communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our annual engagement efforts in 2016, we invited shareholders representing approximately half of our shares outstanding, and other interested parties, to discuss matters of interest to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Topics discussed included our strategy and performance; corporate governance matters; our executive compensation programs; and environmental and social concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The valuable feedback received was then shared with the full Board, which considered the feedback in its decision making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a direct result of these discussions, we adopted a proxy access bylaw giving shareholders holding at least 3 percent of our shares for at least 3 years the right to include in the proxy statement director nominees for up to 20 percent of the Board (but not less than two nominees).

sentences.text: SUSTAINABILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 is dedicated to meeting the world's energy needs responsibly, efficiently and sustainably.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For us, sustainability means manufacturing and delivering affordable, clean products in a safe and environmentally sound manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our sustainability efforts are built on four pillars: operational excellence, environmental commitment, social responsibility and economic performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than one-third of our U.S. refineries have earned the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency ENERGY STAR Award, which recognizes their top-quartile energy efficiency performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, 25 of our sites have received Voluntary Protection Program (VPP) certification for their strong safety records and comprehensive safety and health management systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our commitment to excellence compels us to invest in environmental projects and sustaining capital to improve our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results are industry-leading practices and improved environmental performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We invested more than $5.4 billion in refining environmental projects and improvements from 2003 through 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that time, we reduced SOx emissions by 90 percent, NOx emissions by 55 percent and particulate matter by 57 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 is investing in its future by conducting research to manage water consumption, improve energy efficiency and provide technology to change the future of power generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek solutions for tomorrow's energy needs, from opportunities to blend biofuels into clean products to co-founding forward-looking think tanks, such as the Fuels Institute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 is one of the few energy companies with a state-of-the-art Research Center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have more than 350 scientists and engineers in Bartlesville, Oklahoma, conducting research to enhance the safety and reliability of our operations and to develop future air, water and energy solutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information regarding our commitment to sustainability, including our Sustainability Highlights Brochure, can be found in the Sustainability section of our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD'S RISK OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's management is responsible for the day-to-day conduct of our businesses and operations, including management of risks the Company faces.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To fulfill this responsibility, our management has established an enterprise risk management program designed to identify and facilitate management of the significant and diverse risks facing the Company and the approaches to mitigate such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has broad oversight responsibility over the Company's enterprise risk management program and receives management updates on ts development and implementation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this oversight role, the Board of Directors is responsible for satisfying itself that the risk management processes designed and implemented by the Company's management are functioning as intended, and that necessary steps are taken to foster a culture of risk-adjusted decision making throughout the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In executing its responsibilities, the Board of Directors has delegated to individual committees certain elements of this oversight function, while retaining oversight responsibility for strategic risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this context, the Board of Directors delegated authority to the Audit Committee to facilitate coordination among the Board's committees with respect to oversight of the Company's risk management programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Audit Committee regularly receives updates on the enterprise risk management program and discusses the Company's risk assessment and risk management policies to ensure that our risk management programs are functioning properly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors, either directly or through its committees, exercises its oversight function with respect to all material risks to the Company, which are identified and discussed in the Company's public filings with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CODE OF BUSINESS ETHICS AND CONDUCT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phillips 66 has adopted a Code of Business Ethics and Conduct for Directors and Employees designed to help resolve ethical issues in an increasingly complex global business environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Ethics and Conduct applies to all directors and employees, including the CEO and the Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Ethics and Conduct covers topics including, but not limited to, conflicts of interest, insider trading, competition and fair dealing, discrimination and harassment, confidentiality, payments to government personnel, anti-boycott laws, U.S. embargoes and sanctions, compliance procedures and employee complaint procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Ethics and Conduct is posted on the "Investors" section of our website under the "Governance" caption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also request printed copies of our Code of Business Ethics and Conduct by following the instructions located under the caption Available Information on page 61.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Ethics and Conduct requires that all directors and executive officers promptly bring to the attention of the General Counsel and, in the case of Directors, the Chair of the Nominating Committee or, in the case of executive officers, the Chair of the Audit Committee, any transaction or relationship that arises and of which she or he becomes aware that reasonably could be expected to constitute a related party transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such transaction or relationship is reviewed by the Company's management and the appropriate Board Committee to ensure that it does not constitute a conflict of interest and is reported appropriately.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Nominating Committee conducts an annual review of related party transactions between each of our directors and the Company (and its subsidiaries) and makes recommendations to the Board regarding the continued independence of each Board member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOMINATING PROCESSES OF THE NOMINATING AND GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee consists of four non-employee Directors, all of whom are independent under NYSE listing standards and our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee identifies, considers and recommends director candidates to the Board of Directors with the goal of creating a balance of knowledge, experience and diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the Nominating Committee identifies candidates through the use of a search firm or the business and organizational contacts of the directors and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws permit shareholders to nominate candidates for director election at a shareholders meeting whether or not such nominee is submitted to and evaluated by the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to submit nominees for election at an annual or special meeting of shareholders should follow the procedures described under Submission of Future Shareholder Proposals on page 61.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee will consider director candidates recommended by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder wishes to recommend a candidate for nomination by the Nominating Committee, he or she should follow the same procedures referred to above for nominations to be made directly by the shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the shareholder should provide such other information deemed relevant to the Nominating Committee's evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates recommended by the Company's shareholders are evaluated on the same basis as candidates recommended by the Company's directors, CEO, other executive officers, third-party search firms or other sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1:      Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws provide that the Directors are divided into three classes, which are to be as nearly equal in size as possible, with one class being elected each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has set the current number of Directors at ten, with two classes of three Directors each and one class of four Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director vacancies created between annual shareholder meetings (such as by a current director's death, resignation or removal for cause or an increase in the number of directors) may be filled by a majority vote of the remaining directors then in office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director appointed in this manner would hold office for a term expiring at the annual meeting of shareholders at which the term of office of the class to which he or she has been appointed expires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a vacancy resulted from an action of our shareholders, only our shareholders would be entitled to elect a successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect each nominee will be able to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, however, a nominee is unable to serve and the Board of Directors does not elect to reduce the size of the Board, shares presented by proxies will be voted for a substitute nominated by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws require directors to be elected by the majority of the votes cast with respect to such director (i.e., the number of votes cast "for" a director must exceed the number of votes cast "against" that director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee who is serving as a Director is not elected at the Annual Meeting and no one else is elected in place of that Director, then, under Delaware law, the Director would continue to serve on the Board of Directors as a "holdover director."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, under our By-Laws, the holdover director would be required to tender his or her resignation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee then would consider and recommend to the Board whether to accept or reject the tendered resignation, or whether some other action should be taken.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors would then decide whether to accept the resignation, taking into account the recommendation of the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Director who tenders his or her resignation would not participate in the recommendation of the Nominating Committee or the decision of the Board with respect to his or her resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is required to publicly disclose (by a press release, a filing with the SEC or other broadly disseminated means of communication) its decision regarding the tendered resignation and the rationale behind the decision within 90 days from the date of the certification of the election results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a contested election (a situation in which the number of nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected), the standard for election of directors will be a plurality of the shares represented in person or by proxy at any such meeting and entitled to vote on the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In selecting the 2017 nominees for Director, the Nominating Committee sought candidates who possess the highest personal and professional ethics, integrity and values and are committed to representing the long-term interests of the Company's shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to reviewing a candidate's background and accomplishments, the Nominating Committee reviewed candidates in the context of the current composition of the Board and the evolving needs of the Company's businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also considered the number of boards on which the candidate already serves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Board's policy that at all times at least a substantial majority of its members meets the standards of independence promulgated by the NYSE and the SEC, and as set forth in the Company's Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also seeks to ensure that the Board reflects a range of talents, ages, skills, experiences, diversity, and expertise, particularly in the areas of accounting and finance, management, domestic and international markets, leadership, and energy-related industries, sufficient to provide sound and prudent guidance with respect to the Company's strategic and operational
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2:      Ratification of the Appointment of Ernst & Young LLP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm retained to audit the Company's financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed Ernst & Young LLP to serve as the Company's independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young has been retained as the Company's independent registered public accounting firm continuously since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually considers the independence of the Company's independent auditors prior to the firm's engagement, and periodically considers whether a regular rotation of the independent auditors is necessary to assure continuing independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and its Chairman are directly involved in the selection of Ernst & Young's lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board of Directors believe that the continued retention of Ernst & Young is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking you to vote on a proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD RECOMMENDS THAT YOU VOTE "FOR" THE PROPOSAL TO RATIFY THE APPOINTMENT OF ERNST & YOUNG LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The submission of this matter for approval by shareholders is not legally required, but the Board and the Audit Committee believe it provides an opportunity for shareholders to vote on an mportant aspect of corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shareholders do not ratify the selection of Ernst & Young, the Audit Committee will reconsider the selection of that firm as the Company's ndependent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the Audit Committee may in its discretion select a different independent registered public accounting firm at any ime during the year if it determines that such a change would be in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Services Provided by the Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: udit services of Ernst & Young for fiscal year 2016 included an audit of our consolidated financial statements, an audit of the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial eporting, and services related to periodic filings made with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, Ernst & Young provided certain other services as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the audit of the 2016 onsolidated financial statements, we entered into an engagement agreement with Ernst & Young that set forth the terms by which Ernst & Young performed audit services for us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for negotiating the audit fee associated with its retention of Ernst & Young.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young's fees for professional services totaled $14.5 million and $12.9 million for 2015, which consisted of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees (in millions)  2016  2015    Audit Fees   $ 13.5  $ 11.8  Audit-Related Fees     0.6    0.7  Tax Fees   0.2  0.2  All Other Fees     0.2    0.2  Total   $ 14.5  $ 12.9  (1) (2) (3)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Fees for audit services related to the fiscal year consolidated audit, the audit of the effectiveness of internal controls, quarterly reviews, registration statements, comfort letters, statutory and regulatory audits and accounting consultations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Includes audit fees of Phillips 66 Partners LP of $3.3 million and $1.3 million for 2016 and 2015, respectively, which were approved by the Audit Committee of the General Partner of Phillips 66 Partners LP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Fees for audit-related services related to audits in connection with proposed or consummated dispositions, benefit plan audits, other subsidiary audits, special reports, and accounting consultations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Fees for tax services related to tax compliance services and tax planning and advisory services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has considered whether the non-audit services provided to Phillips 66 by Ernst & Young impaired the independence of Ernst & Young and concluded they did not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has adopted a pre-approval policy that provides guidelines for the audit, audit-related, tax and other non-audit services that Ernst & Young may provide to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the fees in the table above were approved in accordance with this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) identifies the guiding principles that must be considered by the Audit Committee in approving services to ensure that Ernst & Young's independence is not impaired;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) describes the audit, audit-related, tax and other services that may be provided and the non-audit services that are prohibited; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) sets forth pre-approval requirements for all permitted services.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has delegated authority to approve permitted services to its Chair.

sentences.text: Such approval must be reported to the entire Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.

sentences.text: Approval of this proposal requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), Phillips 66 is providing shareholders with the opportunity to vote on an advisory resolution, commonly known as "Say-on-Pay," considering approval of the compensation of its NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, which is responsible for the compensation of our CEO and Senior Officers (as defined on page 40), has overseen the development of compensation program designed to attract, retain and motivate executives who enable us to achieve our strategic and financial goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the Executive Compensation Tables, together with the accompanying narrative disclosures, allow you to view the trends in compensation and application of our compensation philosophies and practices for the years presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the Phillips 66 executive compensation programs align the interests of our executives with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are guided by the philosophy that the Company's ability to provide sustainable value is driven by superior individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that a company must offer competitive compensation to attract and retain experienced, talented and motivated employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board believes employees in leadership roles within the organization are motivated to perform at their highest levels when performance-based pay represents a significant portion of their compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that our philosophy and practices have resulted in executive compensation decisions that are aligned with Company and individual performance, are appropriate in value and have benefited the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote is advisory, it will not be binding upon the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the Compensation Committee and the Board will consider the outcome of the vote when evaluating future executive compensation arrangements.

sentences.text: We believe our compensation programs play an important role in our employee value proposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They allow us to attract, retain, motivate, and reward high-performing executive talent, as well as support succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives have a significant portion of compensation tied to the achievement of annual and long-term goals that promote shareholde
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target and award reasonable and competitive compensation, aligned with market median levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards are differentiated based on performance relative to targets, peers and market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We emphasize Phillips 66 stock ownership by requiring stock ownership levels for our executives that are set at a multiple of their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide executives the same group benefit programs as we provide other employees, on substantially the same terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We limit executive perquisites to items that are common in our peer group and serve a reasonable business purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant Pay at Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our philosophy that executive compensation should be linked to Company performance and directly aligned with shareholder value creation, a significant portion of NEO compensation is at risk and based on performance metrics tied to our corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "At risk" means there is no guarantee that the target value of the awards will be realized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has complete authority to limit and even award nothing for the performance-based payouts and individual performance adjustments under each of the Variable Cash Incentive Program (VCIP) and Performance Share Program (PSP) based on its evaluation of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options can expire with zero value if the Company stock price does not appreciate above the grant date price over the 10-year term of the options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) may lose value depending on stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, for NEOs to earn and sustain competitive compensation, the Company must meet its strategic objectives, perform well relative to peers and deliver market-competitive returns to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Cash Incentive Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The VCIP, which is our annual incentive program, is designed to provide variability and differentiation based on corporate and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through our metrics, we designed our VCIP program to align annual awards with shareholder interests and execution of our corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not tie NEO VCIP awards to the performance of any individual business unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this structure serves the best interests of shareholders as it promotes collaboration across the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible earnings are multiplied by a percentage that is based on each NEO's salary grade level to derive the NEO's target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the performance period, the Compensation Committee reviews the Company's performance to determine the Corporate Payout Percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This percentage is based on a mix of operational and financial metrics, the details and weighting of which are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee can award a Corporate Payout Percentage of zero up to the maximum of 200 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target award is multiplied by the Corporate Payout Percentage, after which the Compensation Committee takes into account the individual accomplishments of each NEO when determining applicable individual performance adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Performance Adjustments can range from +/50 percent of target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments are based on measurable performance of the individual NEO that drives shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee used the following metrics, which are aligned with our corporate strategy, to evaluate corporate performance under the VCIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mix of fi operational metrics was designed to ensure a balanced view of Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 VCIP METRICS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we replaced Adjusted Net Income and Adjusted ROCE, each weighted at 25 percent, with Adjusted EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization) weighted at 40 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted ROCE continues to be a metric in our long-term plan because we believe it is an important measure of long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Adjusted EBITDA is useful in evaluating our annual core operating performance and how we determine enterprise value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our threshold represents the Adjusted EBITDA required to cover our sustaining capital and shareholder dividend commitments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure we continue to deliver on our growth strategy, the target and maximum for Adjusted EBITDA represent returns that are 1.5 percent and 3.0 percent above our Weighted Average Cost of Capital (WACC), respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating Excellence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating excellence, including personal and process safety as well as environmental stewardship and asset availability, is critical to meeting our corporate strategy of growth, returns and distributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We measure ourselves against others in our industry for safety metrics, target sustained performance in environmental stewardship, and effectively manage unplanned downtime.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we increased the weighting of this metric from 25 percent to 35 percent, placing a greater emphasis on availability of our assets, in acknowledgment that the availability of our assets across our business segments is essential to profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For metrics for which comparative data was available, like TRR and Lost Workday Case Rate (LWCR), we benchmarked ourselves against companies with strong safety records in our ndustry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, these companies fall within the top 2 quartiles of all companies reported.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then established our threshold, target, and maximum goals based on the 25th, 50th, and 75th percentiles of this group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For metrics for which comparative data was not available, like asset availability and environmental events, we established our threshold, target, and maximum goals based on our own historical performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For asset availability, we incorporated all of the lines of our business, and then weighted them by EBITDA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we excelled in Operating Excellencebreaking many Company records in the metrics we use to evaluate ourselves in this area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While some financial metrics may be primarily market driven, operating in a safe, environmentally conscious, and efficient way is something that we can control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed each of the following metrics when determining an overall Operating Excellence payout of 196 percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combined TRR and LWCR: Our performance in personal safety was top quartile compared to our industry group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this performance, 200 percent of target was earned for TRR recognizing a 21 percent improvement over 2015 and the best TRR performance in our Company history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, 170 percent of target was earned for LWCR recognizing that while 2016 was a good year compared to our industry group, performance in this area was slightly impaired relative to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Process Safety Rate: Our Process Safety Event Rate was the best in our Company history, and a 75 percent reduction from 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, 200 percent of target was earn for this metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental Events: The Compensation Committee considered that in the industries in which we operate there is increasingly stringent regulation and scrutiny on environmental performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We beat our stretch objective by 5 percent and achieved the lowest number of reportable environmental events in our Company history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, 200 percent of target was earned related to this metric.

sentences.text: Adjusted Controllable Costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted Controllable Costs focuses on operating excellence and our ability to deliver differentiated returns to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our targets are based on our budget for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we reduced the weighting of this metric from 25 percent to 15 percent because, as a financial measure, the effect of cost management is also recognized in Adjusted EBITDA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We established our threshold, target, and maximum goals as a percentage of budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For threshold performance, we could not exceed budget by more than 5 percent, target performance was based on achieving budget, and maximum performance required being at least 2 percent under budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of the performance period, we then considered our costs relative to our peer group to ensure alignment with industry trends and to reflect operating decisions made in response to changing market conditions that vary from budget assumptions, to ensure earned amounts are appropriate given relative performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we were 4 percent improved versus our budget, which could have resulted in a payout at 200 percent; however, the Compensation Committee exercised negative discretion recognizing that we were third in a group of six refining peers on costs per barrel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our programs deliver 50 percent of long-term target value in the form of Performance Share Units (PSUs), 25 percent in the form of stock options and 25 percent in the form of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this mix of awards is aligned with our compensation philosophy, reflects the cyclical nature of our business, promotes retention of our high-performing talent, supports succession planning and is consistent with market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 LTI PROGRAMS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each PSP has a three-year performance period, and therefore three PSPs are in progress at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By delivering 50% of LTI through the PSP, a significant portion of NEO compensation is tied to Company and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target Shares at Beginning of Performance Period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the Compensation Peer Group to benchmark LTI and establish base salary multiples for similar roles at peer organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the target performance share value is determined, it is tracked as shares of Company stock for the remainder of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of arget shares is determined by using the average of the stock's fair market value for the 20 days prior to the start of the performance period, less anticipated dividends during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target shares may be adjusted during the performance period for significant changes in responsibility that occur during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO provides input regarding awards made to all NEOs (other than himself).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates the individual performance of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes in applying performance adjustments at the beginning of the performance period, rather than the end, so that performance-adjusted compensation is subject to company performance and market volatility throughout the performance period, aligning executive compensation with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs hired after the start of the performance period may receive prorated target shares in ongoing PSP cycles, at the discretion of the Compensation Committee, so that the interests are immediately aligned with the Company long-term goals and shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance metrics used for all three PSP programs in effect in 2016 are 50 percent ROCE, equally weighted between absolute and relative, and 50 percent relative TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers ROCE an important measure of Company growth and overall performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates our results relative to our Performance Peer Group as well as absolute targets based on our WACC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The absolute ROCE maximum delivers 3.0 percent above WACC over the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target delivers 1.5 percent above our WACC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The threshold is a return percentage equivalent to the Adjusted EBITDA required to cover our sustaining capital and shareholder dividend commitments over the 3-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 25 percent of the LTI target value was delivered to executives in the form of stock options.

sentences.text: These awards are inherently performance-based as the stock price must increase before the executive can realize any gain.

sentences.text: We believe stock options drive behaviors and actions that enhance long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are typically granted in February each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of options awarded is based on the Black-Scholes-Merton model.

sentences.text: The exercise price of stock options is set at 100 percent of the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted to our NEOs in February 2016 vest ratably over a three-year period and have a ten-year erm.

sentences.text: These stock options neither have voting rights nor entitle the holder to receive dividends.

sentences.text: Comprehensive Security Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a comprehensive security program to address the increased security risks for certain senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Garland and Mr. Taylor were the only NEOs in 2016 designated by the Board as requiring increased security under this program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Garland was covered for the entire year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Taylor was covered beginning March 1, 2016, following a security review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program allows for certain additional security measures in specific situations when the senior executive is traveling by car or airplane on Company business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An additional security review of the NEO's personal residence is also included.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any additional costs to the Company for these activities are reported as All Other Compensation and included in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Retirement Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain the following supplemental retirement plans for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voluntary Deferred Compensation PlanThis plan (the Phillips 66 Key Employee Deferred Compensation Plan, which we refer to as the KEDCP) provides tax-efficient retirement savings by allowing executives to voluntarily defer both the receipt and taxation of a portion of their base salary and annual bonus until a specified date or when they leave the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further information on the KEDCP is provided in the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined Contribution Restoration PlanThis plan (the Phillips 66 Defined Contribution Make-Up Plan, which we refer to as the DCMP) restores benefits capped under our qualified defined contribution plan due to IRC limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further information on the DCMP is provided in the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined Benefit Restoration PlanThis plan (the Phillips 66 Key Employee Supplemental Retirement Plan, which we refer to as the KESRP) restores Company-sponsored benefits capped under the qualified defined benefit pension plan due to IRC limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further information on the KESRP is provided in the Pension Benefits as of December 31, 2016 table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Life Insurance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide life insurance policies to all U.S. based employees with a face value approximately equal to their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our NEOs, the face value of this coverage is approximately two times their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Severance and Change in Control Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not maintain individual severance or change in control agreements with our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we maintain the Phillips 66 Executive Severance Plan (ESP) and the Phillips 66 Change in Control Severance Plan (CICSP) to accomplish several specific objectives, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensuring shareholder interests are protected during business transactions by providing benefits that promote senior management stability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing and preserving an economic motivation for participating executives to consider a business combination that might result in an executive's job loss.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competing effectively in attracting and retaining executives in an industry that features frequent acquisitions and divestitures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives may not participate in both plans as a result of the same severance event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other benefits, the ESP provides a payment equal to one and one-half or two times the executive's base salary, depending on salary grade level, if he or she is involuntarily terminated without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CICSP provides a payment equal to two or three times the sum of the executive's base salary and the greater of his or her target bonus or average of the last two bonus payments, depending on salary grade level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive must be involuntarily terminated without cause in connection with a change in control or terminate employment for good reason within two years after the change in control to be eligible for CICSP payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This "double rigger" requirement is in the best interest of shareholders and is considered a best practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Details of potential payments under these plans are outlined in the Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These plans do not provide any excise tax gross- up protections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax ConsiderationsInternal Revenue Code Section 162(m)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers the deductibility of compensation under IRC Section 162(m) when making decisions and generally attempts to structure elements of executive compensation to meet the requirements for deductibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee has the flexibility to design and maintain the programs in the most beneficial manner to shareholders, including payments that may be subject to the deductibility limits under IRC Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 the Compensation Committee believes it has taken the necessary steps intended to qualify payments made under the VCIP and awards made under the LTI programs (PSP and RSUs) as performance-based under IRC Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trading Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy prohibits all employees and directors from trading Company stock while in possession of material, non-publicly disclosed information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy requires executive and directors, as well as employees with regular access to insider information, to follow specific pre-clearance procedures before entering into transactions in our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy prohibits hedging transactions related to our stock or pledging our stock, including any stock the executive or director may hold in excess of his or her stock ownership guideline requirements.

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees management's risk assessment of all elements of our compensation programs, policies and practices for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has conclude that our compensation programs, policies and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relevant provisions of our programs include, but are not limited to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VCIP and LTI metrics are aligned with our corporate strategy to ensure continued focus on actions that drive shareholder valu
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VCIP and LTI compensation targets increase with each pay grade, emphasizing shareholder value creation over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintaining a level of discretion in the performance-based programs, which enables the Compensation Committee to award zero payouts to executives who perform poorly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback provisions that allow for reduction in awards for executives who expose the Company to undue risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LTI design that provides incentives for executive retention and Company and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines that align executive interests with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers senior management succession planning a core part of the Company's risk management program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least annually, the Compensation Committee eviews with the CEO succession planning for senior leadership positions (other than the CEO position itself, for which succession planning is reviewed by the Nomination Committee), and he timing and development required to ensure continuity of leadership over the short- and long-terms, to manage risk in this area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROLE OF THE HUMAN RESOURCES AND COMPENSATION COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authority and Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for providing independent, objective oversight of our executive compensation programs and determining the compensation for our CEO and anyone who meets our definition of a Senior Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, our internal guidelines define a Senior Officer as an officer of the Company who reports directly to the CEO or any other officer of the Company who is either a Senior Vice President or above or a reporting officer under Section 16(b) of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, we had 11 Senior Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation tables that follow provide information about our CEO and certain of our Senior Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee acts as plan administrator of the compensation programs and benefit plans for our CEO and Senior Officers and as an avenue of appeal for current and former Senior Officers regarding disputes over compensation and benefits.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees the Company's executive compensation philosophy, policies, plans and programs for our CEO and Senior Officers to ensure:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alignment of our executive compensation programs with the long-term economic interests of shareholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitiveness of compensation within the markets in which Phillips 66 competes for talent,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of top talent, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Development of a diverse talent pool with respect to CEO and Senior Officer succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the Compensation Committee's responsibilities is to assist the Board in its oversight of the integrity of the Company's Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Human Resources and Compensation Committee Report summarizes certain Compensation Committee activities concerning compensation earned during 2016 by our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A complete listing of the authority and responsibilities of the Compensation Committee is set forth in its written charter adopted by the Board of Directors, which is available in the "Investors" section of our website under the caption "Governance."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee consists of four members who meet all requirements for "non-employee," "independent" and "outside" director status under the Exchange Act, NYSE listing standards, and the IRC, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Compensation Committee and the member to be designated as Chair, like the members and Chairs of all the Board committees, are reviewed annually by the Nominating Committee, which recommends committee appointments to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has final approval of the committee structure of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee holds regularly scheduled meetings in association with regular Board meetings and meets by teleconference between such meetings as necessary to discharge its duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reserves time at each regularly scheduled meeting to review matters in executive session without management present except as specifically requested by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee had five regularly scheduled meetings and one additional telephonic meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information regarding the Compensation Committee's activities at such meetings can be found in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuous Improvement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is committed to a process of continuous improvement in exercising its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, the Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receives ongoing training regarding best practices for executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly reviews its responsibilities and governance practices in light of ongoing changes in the legal and regulatory arena and trends in corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review is aided by the Company's management, the Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant, and, when deemed appropriate, independent legal counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually reviews its charter and proposes any desired changes to the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually conducts a self-assessment of its performance that evaluates the effectiveness of the Compensation Committee's actions and seeks ideas to improve its processes and oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly reviews and assesses whether the Company's executive compensation programs are having the desired effects without encour
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly reviews all its activities, including its self-assessment and a compensation risk assessment, with the full Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review with Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis presented in this proxy statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussions with Independent Executive Compensation Consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has discussed with Mercer, an independent executive compensation consulting firm, the executive compensation programs of the Company, as well as specific compensation decisions made by the Compensation Committee for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer was retained directly by the Compensation Committee, independent of the management of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has received written disclosure from Mercer confirming the consultant's ndependence, has discussed with Mercer its independence from Phillips 66, and believes Mercer to be independent of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation to the Phillips 66 Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review and discussions noted above, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in the Phillips 66 proxy statement on Schedule 14A and the Phillips 66 Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: The amounts shown reflect the actual payments made by us in 2016, which due to processing delays can include contributions in 2015 that were matched b the Company in 2016 and are therefore reported in this proxy statement.
