sentences.text: (g) The amounts shown primarily reflect payments by us relating to certain taxes incurred by the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we made these tax payments for three different reasons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, Mr. Herman received tax assistance after he exercised stock options that he had been granted while an expatriate employee prior to becoming an NEO ($563,107).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All expatriate employees receive this tax assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, we provide tax assistance when we request family members or other guests to accompany an NEO to a Company function and, as a result, the NEO is deemed to make personal use of Company assets such as Company aircraft and thereby incurs imputed income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this type of expense is appropriately characterized as a business expense and, if the NEO incurs imputed income in accordance with applicable tax laws, we will generally reimburse the NEO for any increased tax costs (Mr. Garland $12,454; Mr. Herman $1,499; Ms. Johnson $4,497; Mr. Mitchell $905; and Mr. Taylor $10,259).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we provide tax assistance on miscellaneous gifts such as duffel bags, jackets, and ornaments received as a member of the Board or the Executive Leadership Team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total cost of these gifts and the tax assistance are as follows: Mr. Garland $407, Mr. Herman $357, Ms. Johnson $248, Mr. Mitchell $359, and Mr. Taylor $407.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also included are miscellaneous benefits such as those required for employees covered under our Comprehensive Security Program, which includes Mr. Garland and, effective March 1, 2016, Mr. Taylor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits include the use of a car and driver when required (Mr Garland $5,505; Mr. Taylor $2,016) and home security fees that are in excess of the cost of a "standard" system typical for homes in their neighborhood (Mr. Garland $585).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) The Phillips 66 Comprehensive Security Program requires in certain circumstances that Mr. Garland and, effective March 1, 2016, Mr. Taylor fly on Company aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount presented above represents the approximate incremental cost to Phillips 66 for personal use of the aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximate incremental cost has been determined by calculating the variable costs for each aircraft during the year, dividing that amount by the total number of miles flown by that aircraft, and multiplying the result by the miles flown for personal use during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incremental costs for flights to the hangar or other locations without passengers, commonly referred to as "deadhead" flights, are included in the calculation.

sentences.text: In 2016, that limit was $265,000.

sentences.text: The IRC also limits the annual benefit available under these Titles expressed as an annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, that limit was $210,000 (reduced actuarially for ages below 62).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) NEOs whose combined years of age and service total less than 44 receive a six percent pay credit, those with 44 through 65 receive a seven percent pay credit and those with 66 or more receive a nine percent pay credit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest credits are applied to the cash balance account each month.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This credit is calculated by multiplying the value of the account by the interest credit rate, based on 30-year U.S. Treasury security rates adjusted quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) An early benefit reduction is calculated on Title I by reducing the benefit 5% for each year before age 60 that benefits are paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An early benefit reduction is calculated on Title III by reducing the benefit 6.67% for each year before age 60 that benefits are paid, unless the participant has at least 85 points awarded, with one point for each year of age and one point for each year of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Title IV early benefit reduction is calculated by reducing the benefit by 5% per year for each year before age 57 that benefits are paid and 4% per year for benefits that are paid between ages 57 and 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit calculation for Titles I, III and IV is reduced by the product of 1.5% of the annual primary social security benefit multiplied by years of credited service, although a reduction limit of 50% of the primary Social Security benefit may apply.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Under Title I, if an executive receives layoff benefits, then the eligible compensation calculation also includes the annualized salary for the year of layoff (rather than the actual salary for that year) and years of service are increased by any period for which layoff benefits are calculated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) Mr. Herman has a frozen benefit under Title III from prior years of service with predecessor companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NONQUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are eligible to participate in two nonqualified deferred compensation plans, the Phillips 66 KEDCP and the Phillips 66 DCMP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The KEDCP allows NEOs to defer up to 50 percent of their salary and up to 100 percent of their VCIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The default distribution option is a lump sum payment paid at least six months after separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs may elect to defer payments from one to five years, and to receive annual, semiannual or quarterly payments for a period of up to fifteen years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs may also elect to defer their VCIP to a specific date in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DCMP is a nonqualified restoration plan for employer contributions that cannot be made to our 401(k) plan either due to an NEO's salary deferral under the KEDCP or due to the IRC annual limit on compensation that may be taken into account under a qualified plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions are made as a lump sum six months after separation from service, unless the NEO elects to receive one to fifteen annual payments beginning at least one year after separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO directs investments of his or her individual accounts under the KEDCP and DCMP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both plans provide a broad range of market-based investments that may be changed daily.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No investment provides above-market returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate performance of these investments is reflected in the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits due under these plans are paid from our general assets, although we also maintain rabbi trusts that may be used to pay benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trusts and the funds held in them are Company assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of our bankruptcy, NEOs would be unsecured general creditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESP provides that if an NEO separates due to an involuntary termination without cause, the executive will receive the following benefits, which may vary depending on salary grade lev

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to one and one-half or two times the sum of the executive's base salary and current target annual bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to the present value of the increase in pension benefits that would result from crediting the executive with an additional one and one-half or two years of age and service under the pension plan.

sentences.text: Accelerated Equity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Layoff treatment under our compensation plans generally allows the executive to retain a prorated portion of grants held less than one year and full grants held for one year or more of Restricted Stock, RSUs, and Stock Options, and maintain eligibility for PSP awards for ongoing periods in which he or she had participated for at least one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CICSP provides that if, within two years of a change in control of the Company, an executive's employment is terminated by the employer other than for cause, or by the executive for good reason, the executive will receive the following benefits, which may vary depending on salary grade level:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Severance Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to two or three times the sum of the executive's base salary and the higher of the current target annual bonus or the average of the annual bonuses paid for the previous two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment equal to the present value of the increase in pension benefits that would result from crediting the executive with an additional two or three years of age an service under the pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum payment generally equal to the Company contribution for active employees toward the cost of certain welfare benefits for an additional two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary elements of our non-employee Director compensation program are equity compensation and cash compensation, the current levels of which have been in place since January 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OBJECTIVES AND PRINCIPLES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for non-employee Directors is reviewed annually by the Nominating Committee, with the assistance of such third-party consultants as the Nominating Committee deems advisable, and set by action of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board's goal in designing such compensation is to provide a competitive package that will enable it to attract and retain highly skilled individuals with relevant experience and reflects the time and talent required to serve on the board of a complex, multinational corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board seeks to provide sufficient flexibility in the form of payment to meet individual needs while ensuring that a substantial portion of director compensation is linked to the long-term success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of our commitment to be a socially responsible member of the communities in which we participate, the Board believes that it is appropriate to extend the Phillips 66 matching gift program to charitable contributions made by individual Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each non-employee Director received a grant of RSUs with an aggregate value of $200,000 on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restrictions on the units issued to a non-employee Director will lapse in the event of retirement, disability, death, or a change of control, unless the Director has elected to receive the underlying shares after a stated period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors forfeit the units if, prior to the lapse of restrictions, the Board finds sufficient cause for forfeiture (although no such finding can be made after a change in control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before the restrictions lapse, Directors cannot sell or otherwise transfer the units, but the units are credited with dividend equivalents in the form of additional RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When restrictions lapse, Directors will receive unrestricted shares of Company stock as settlement of the RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n 2016, each non-employee Director received $125,000 in cash compensation for service as a Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee Directors serving in specified committee or leadership positions al received the following additional cash compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LEAD / CHAIR   MEMBER   Lead Director   $ 50,000  N/A  Audit and Finance Committee   $ 25,000  $ 10,000  Human Resources and Compensation Committee   $ 25,000  $ 10,000  All Other Committees   $ 10,000    N/A
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total annual cash compensation is payable in monthly cash installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may elect, on an annual basis, to receive all or part of their cash compensation in unrestricted stock or in RSUs (such unrestricted stock or RSUs are issued on the last business day of the month valued using the average of the high and low prices of Phillips 66 common stock as reported on the NYSE on such date), or to have the amount credited to the Director's deferred compensation account as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSUs issued in lieu of cash compensation are subject to the same restrictions as the annual RSUs described above under Equity Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferral of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee Directors can elect to defer their cash compensation under the Phillips 66 Deferred Compensation Program for non-Employee Directors (the "Director Deferral Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred amounts are deemed to be invested in various mutual funds and similar investment choices (including Phillips 66 common stock) selected by the Director from a list of investment choices available under the Director Deferral Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The future payment of any compensation deferred by non-employee Directors of Phillips 66 may be funded in a grantor trust designed for this purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors' Matching Gift Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All active and retired non-employee Directors are eligible to participate in the Directors' Annual Matching Gift Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This provides a dollar-for-dollar match of gifts of cash or securities, up to a maximum during any one calendar year of $15,000 per donor for active Directors and $7,500 per donor for retired Directors, to charities and educational institutions (excluding certain religious, political, fraternal, or collegiate athletic organizations) that are tax-exempt under Section 501(c)(3) of the IRC or meet similar requirements under the applicable law of other countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts representing these matching contributions are contained in the "All Other Compensation" column of the Non-employee Director Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 16(a) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires directors and executive officers of Phillips 66, and persons who own more than 10 percent of a registered class of Phillips 66 equity securities, to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership of Phillips 66 common stock with the SEC and the NYSE, and to furnish Phillips 66 with copies of the forms they file.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our knowledge, based solely upon a review of the copies of such reports furnished to the Company and written representations of our officers and directors, during the year ended December 31, 2016, all Section 16(a) reports applicable to those officers and directors were filed on a timely basis, except for the following: (1) a Form 4 that was filed on March 7, 2016, on behalf of Chukwuemka Oyolu, Vice President and Controller, related to a sale by his spouse on February 29, which was delayed while awaiting information from the executing broker; (2) a Form 4 that was filed on September 22, 2016, on behalf of Robert Herman, Executive Vice President, Midstream, related to a sale on September 15, which was delayed while awaiting information from the executing broker; and (3) a Form 4 that was filed on January 12, 2017, on behalf of Greg Garland, Chairman and CEO, related to Phillips 66 stock held by his late father's estate; Mr. Garland became the executor of the estate on September 26, 2016, and discovered that his father owned the stock subsequent to the filing of a Form 4 on behalf of Mr. Garland in November 2016.

sentences.text: ABOUT THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is soliciting my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Phillips 66 is soliciting proxies to be voted at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Phillips 66.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote if you were the record owner of Phillips 66 common stock as of the close of business on March 10, 2017, the record date established by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock is entitled to one vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 10, 2017, we had 516,970,525 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many shares must be present to hold the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n order for us to hold our meeting, holders of a majority of our outstanding shares of common stock as of March 10, 2017, must be present in person or by proxy at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is eferred to as a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares are counted as present at the Annual Meeting if you attend the meeting and vote in person or if you properly return a proxy by Internet, telephone or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will also be counted for purposes of establishing a quorum at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is a broker non-vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applicable rules permit brokers to vote shares held for the benefit of their clients on routine matters when the brokers have not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner on how to vote those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of an independent auditor is an example of a routine matter on which brokers may vote in this manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers may not vote shares held for the benefit of their clients on non-routine matters, such as the election of directors, proposals relating to executive compensation and proposals to amend certificates of incorporation and certain other corporate governance changes, unless they have received voting instructions from the beneficial owner on how to vote those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares that are not voted by brokers on non-routine matters are called broker non-votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes are needed to approve each of the proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the director nominees requires the affirmative "FOR" vote of the majority of the votes cast in person or by proxy at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other proposals require the affirmative "FOR" vote of a majority of those shares present in person or represented by proxy at the meeting and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote either in person at the meeting or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement, the accompanying proxy card and the Company's 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders are being made available to the Company's shareholders on the Internet at www.proxyvote.com through the notice and access process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's 2016 Annual Report to Shareholders contains consolidated financial statements and reports of the independent registered public accounting firm, management's discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations, information concerning the quarterly financial data for the past two fiscal years, and other information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote by proxy, you must do one of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote over the Internet (instructions are on the proxy card)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote by telephone (instructions are on the proxy card)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you elected to receive a hard copy of your proxy materials, fill out the enclosed proxy card, date and sign it, and return it in the enclosed postage-paid envelope
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f you hold your Phillips 66 stock in a brokerage account (that is, in "street name"), your ability to vote by telephone or over the Internet depends on your broker's voting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please follow he directions on your proxy card or voter instruction form carefully.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we encourage you to vote your shares by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to vote in person at the Annual Meeting and you hold your Phillips 66 stock in street name, you must obtain a proxy from your broker and bring that proxy to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote if I hold my stock through a Phillips 66 employee benefit plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your stock through a Phillips 66 employee benefit plan, you must either:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote over the Internet (instructions are in the email sent to you or on the notice and access form)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote by telephone (instructions are on the notice and access form)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you elected to receive a hard copy of your proxy materials, fill out the enclosed voting instruction form, date and sign it, and return it in the enclosed postage-paid envelope
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will receive a separate voting instruction form for each employee benefit plan in which you hold Phillips 66 stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please pay close attention to the deadline for returning your voting nstruction form to the plan trustee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The voting deadline for each plan is set forth on the voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that different plans may have different deadlines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I revoke my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can revoke your proxy by sending written notice of revocation of your proxy to our Corporate Secretary so that it is received prior to 5:00 p.m., Central Daylight Time, on May 2, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change my vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: es.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can change your vote at any time before the polls close at the Annual Meeting, which will void any earlier vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can change your vote by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting again by telephone or over the Internet prior to 11:59 p.m., Eastern Daylight Time, on May 2, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Signing another proxy card with a later date and returning it to us prior to the meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting again at the meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: you hold your Phillips 66 stock in street name, you must contact your broker to obtain information regarding changing your voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who counts the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hired Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. to count the votes represented by proxies and cast by ballot, and appointed Jim Gaughan of Carl T. Hagberg and Associates to act as Inspector of Election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Will my shares be voted if I don't provide my proxy and don't attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For shares held in your name, if you do not provide a proxy or vote your shares at the Annual Meeting, those shares will not be voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares in street name, your broker may be able to vote those shares for certain "routine" matters even if you do not provide the broker with voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only the ratificatio of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2017 is considered to be a routine matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not give your broker instructions on how to vote your shares, the broker will return the proxy card without voting on proposals not considered "routine."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is a broker non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without instructions from you, the broker may not vote on any proposals other than the ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How are votes counted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all proposals, you may vote "FOR," "AGAINST," or "ABSTAIN."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote to "ABSTAIN" on the election of directors, it is not considered as a vote cast and, therefore, your vote will reduce the number, but not the percentage, of affirmative votes needed to elect the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote to "ABSTAIN" on the other proposals, your shares are still considered as presen and entitled to vote and, therefore, your abstention has the same effect as a vote "AGAINST."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I return my proxy but don't vote for some of the matters listed on my proxy card?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you return a signed proxy card without indicating your vote, your shares will be voted "FOR" the director nominees listed on the card, "FOR" the ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm for Phillips 66 for fiscal year 2017, and "FOR" the approval of the compensation of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Could other matters be decided at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not aware of any other matters to be presented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any other matters are properly brought before the Annual Meeting, the persons named in your proxy will vo n accordance with their best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary authority to vote on other matters is included in the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When will the Company announce the results of the vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within four business days of the Annual Meeting, we will file a Current Report on Form 8-K announcing the results of the vote at the Annual Meetin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who can attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting is open to all holders of Phillips 66 common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder is permitted to bring one guest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No cameras, recording equipment, large bags, briefcases or packages will be permitted in the Annual Meeting, and security measures will be in effect to provide for the safety of attendees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Do I need a ticket to attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes, you will need an admission ticket or proof of ownership of Phillips 66 stock to enter the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered in your name, you will find an admission ticket attached to the proxy card sent to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in the name of your broker or bank or you received your materials electronically, you will need to bring evidence of your stock ownership, such as your most recent brokerage statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders will be required to present valid picture identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IF YOU DO NOT HAVE VALID PICTURE IDENTIFICATION AND EITHER AN ADMISSION TICKET OR PROOF THAT YOU OWN PHILLIPS 66 STOCK, YOU MAY NOT BE ADMITTED INTO THE MEETING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I access the Phillips 66 proxy materials and annual report electronically?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement, the accompanying proxy card and the Company's 2016 Annual Report are being made available to the Company's shareholders on the Internet at www.proxyvote.com through the notice and access process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most shareholders can elect to view future proxy statements and annual reports over the Internet instead of receiving paper copies in the mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own Phillips 66 stock in your name, you can choose this option, and help conserve resources and save the cost of producing and mailing these documents, by checking the box for electronic delivery on your proxy card or by following the instructions provided when you vote by telephone or over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your Phillips 66 stock through a bank, broker or other holder of record, please refer to the information provided by that entity for instructions on how to elect to view future proxy statements and annual reports over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to view future proxy statements and annual reports over the Internet, you will receive a Notice of Internet Availability next year containing the Internet address to use to access our proxy statement and annual report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your choice will remain in effect unless you change your election following the receipt of a Notice of Internet Availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You do not have to elect Internet access each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you later change your mind and would like to receive paper copies of our proxy statements and annual reports, you can request both by phone at 800-579-1639 by email at sendmaterial@proxyvote.com, through the Internet at www.proxyvote.com or by writing to Phillips 66, c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc., 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will need your 12-digit control number located on your Notice of Internet Availability to request a package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will also be provided with the opportunity to receive a copy of the proxy statement and annual report in future mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has a policy that shareholder proxies, ballots, and tabulations that identify shareholders are to be maintained in confidence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No such document will be available for examination, and the identity and vote of any shareholder will not be disclosed, except as necessary to meet legal requirements and allow the inspectors of election to certify the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the cost of this proxy solicitation?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has sent you this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors, officers and employees may solicit proxies by mail, by email, by telephone or in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those persons will receive no additional compensation for any solicitation activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will request banking institutions, brokerage firms, custodians, trustees, nominees and fiduciaries to forward solicitation materials to the beneficial owners of common stock held of record by those entities, and we will, upon the request of those record holders, reimburse reasonable forwarding expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay the costs of preparing, printing, assembling and mailing the proxy materials used in the solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have hired Alliance Advisors, LLC to assist us in soliciting proxies, which it may do by telephone or in person.

sentences.text: We anticipate paying Alliance Advisors, LLC a fee of $15,000, plus expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did my household receive a single set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) rules permit us to deliver a single copy of an annual report and proxy statement to any household not participating in electronic proxy material delivery at which two or more shareholders reside, if we believe the shareholders are members of the same family.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This benefits both you and the Company, as it eliminates duplicate mailings that shareholders living at the same address receive and conserves resources and reduces printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This rule applies to any annual reports, proxy statements, proxy statements combined with a prospectus or information statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each shareholder will continue to receive a separate proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your household may have received a single set of proxy materials this year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you prefer to receive your own copy now or in future years, please request a duplicate set by phone at 800-579-1639, through the Internet at www.proxyvote.com, by email at sendmaterial@proxyvote.com, or by writing to Phillips 66, c/o Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc., 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders sharing the same address can request delivery of a single copy of these materials using the same methods described in the preceding sentence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a broker or other nominee holds your shares, you may continue to receive some duplicate mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain brokers will eliminate duplicate account mailings by allowing shareholders to consent to such elimination, or through implied consent if a shareholder does not request continuation of duplicate mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because not all brokers and nominees may offer shareholders the opportunity to request eliminating duplicate mailings, you may need to contact your broker or nominee directly to discontinue duplicate mailings to your household.

sentences.text: SUBMISSION OF FUTURE SHAREHOLDER PROPOSALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SEC rules, if a shareholder wants us to include a proposal in our proxy statement and form of proxy for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, our Corporate Secretary must receive the proposal at our principal executive offices by November 22, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such proposal must comply with the requirements of Rule 14a-8 promulgated under the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our By-Laws, and as SEC rules permit, shareholders must follow certain procedures to nominate a person for election as a director at an annual or special meeting, or to introduce an em of business at an annual meeting (other than a proposal submitted under Rule 14a-8).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these procedures, shareholders must submit the proposed nominee or item of business by elivering a notice to the Corporate Secretary at the following address: Corporate Secretary, Phillips 66, P.O. Box 4428, Houston, Texas 77210.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We must receive notice as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We must receive notice of a shareholder's intention to introduce a nomination or proposed item of business for an annual meeting not less than 90 days nor more than 120 days before the first anniversary of the prior year's meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuming that our 2017 Annual Meeting is held on schedule, we must receive notice pertaining to the 2018 Annual Meeting no earlier than January 3, 2018, and no later than February 2, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if we hold the annual meeting on a date that is not within 30 days before or after such anniversary date, and if our first public announcement of the date of such annual meeting is less than 100 days prior to the date of such meeting, we must receive the notice no later than 10 days after the public announcement of such meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we hold a special meeting to elect directors, we must receive a shareholder's notice of intention to introduce a nomination no later than 10 days after the earlier of the date we first provide notice of the meeting to shareholders or announce it publicly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by Article II of our By-Laws, a notice of a proposed nomination must include information about the shareholder and the nominee, as well as a written consent of the proposed nominee to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A notice of a proposed item of business must include a description of and the reasons for bringing the proposed business to the meeting, any material interest of the shareholder in the business and certain other information about the shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can obtain a copy of our By-Laws by writing the Corporate Secretary at the address above, or via our website under the "Governance" caption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AVAILABLE INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC rules require us to provide an annual report to shareholders who receive this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional printed copies of the annual report to shareholders, as well as our Corporate Governance Guidelines, Code of Business Ethics and Conduct, charters for each of the committees of the Board of Directors and our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016, including the financial statements and the financial statement schedules, are available without charge to shareholders upon written request to Phillips 66 Investor Relations Department, P.O. Box 4428, Houston, Texas 77210 or via the Internet at www.Phillips66.com.

sentences.text: NON-GAAP FINANCIAL MEASURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discussion of our results in this proxy statement includes references to our "adjusted EBITDA," "PSP ROCE," and "adjusted controllable costs" amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures are not measures of financial performance under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and may not be defined and calculated by other companies using the same or similar terminology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA is a non-GAAP financial measure because it adjusts net income to exclude depreciation and amortization, net interest expense and income taxes, as well as certain items o expense or income that management does not consider representative of our core operating performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this measure as a factor in assessing performance for the purposes of compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A reconciliation of adjusted EBITDA to net income, the most directly comparable GAAP financial measure, is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSP ROCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe PSP ROCE is an important metric for evaluating the quality of capital allocation decisions, measuring portfolio value, and measuring the efficiency and profitability of capital investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this measure as a factor in assessing performance for the purposes of compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSP ROCE is a ratio, the numerator of which is adjusted earnings plus after-tax interest expense, and the denominator of which is average adjusted total equity plus total debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our calculation of PSP ROCE, and its reconciliation to ROCE prepared using GAAP amounts, is set forth below.

sentences.text: Adjusted Controllable Costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted controllable costs is a measure of how effectively we manage costs versus internal targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this measure as a factor in assessing performance for the purposes of compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted controllable costs is a non-GAAP financial measure because it excludes certain costs that we believe are not directly relevant to compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A reconciliation of adjusted controllable costs to the sum of operating expenses and selling, general and administrative expenses, the most directly comparable GAAP measures, is set forth below.
